Rainfall early Christmas gift for Gisborne’s farmers and growers https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/rainfall-early-christmas-gift-for-gisbornes-farmers-and-growers/25SDDRBDTVB4TL3NJTMBCKL4UA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/rainfall-early-christmas-gift-for-gisbornes-farmers-and-growers/25SDDRBDTVB4TL3NJTMBCKL4UA/ Murray RobertsonFarmers say the rain this week proves that Santa is real and it's been a blessing. Fri, 20 Dec 2024 00:53:59 +0000 Farmers throughout the region have welcomed the rain this week with open arms. Whāngārā farmer Toby Williams said it proves there is a Santa, it's such good news before Christmas. He stands next to a very healthy-looking rain gauge.

Gisborne’s Norma Hooks retires from Plunket after 32 years of service https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-norma-hooks-retires-from-plunket-after-32-years-of-service/6WIT36LKIBE23IJUBM7IK7ALVE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-norma-hooks-retires-from-plunket-after-32-years-of-service/6WIT36LKIBE23IJUBM7IK7ALVE/ Kim Parkinson'Miss my colleagues': Plunket stalwart retires after three decades Fri, 20 Dec 2024 00:06:09 +0000 Norma Hooks (centre) retires from Plunket today after 32 years of service. She is pictured with the Gisborne Plunket team of (from left) Lyn Johnston, Lisa Smith, Mona Bradley, Anya Goodall, Lilian Jackson and Jelaire Poi. Photo / Kim Parkinson
